checklist_10.Description: 3. Schizophrenia or bipolar disorder based on the MINI interview

checklist_11.Description: 4. Active suicidal ideation with intent or plan determined by self-report or assessment by PI or study staff during the initial screening or any other phase of the study

checklist_12.Description: 5. Positive drug test for amphetamines, opioids, cannabis, alcohol, PCP, or cocaine confirmed by breath analyzer and urine tests

checklist_13.Description: 6. Any active skin disorder that affects skin integrity of the scalp

checklist_14.Description: 7. Having any condition that would preclude undergoing an fMRI scan or tACS stimulation based on the fMRI safety and tACS safety checklists

checklist_15.Description: 8. Unstable medical disorder reported in subject's medical history or by a clinician assessment

checklist_18.Description: 11. Any other condition the PI or study staff feel would put the subject at risk for entering the study

checklist_2.Description:
2. Age ≥18 and <  61 years old

Age:  <font color ="00008B">[checklist_age]</font>

checklist_4.Description: 4. Diagnosed with Opioid Use Disorder (last 12 months) based on the MINI interview (DSM V)

checklist_5.Description: 5. Being abstinent from Opioids in an addiction treatment program for at least one week based on medical records or self-report

checklist_6.Description: 6. Positive response to Opioid cue-reactivity screening (OCRS), OCRS Score>30)

checklist_6a.Description: OCRS Score: mean drug cue score (out of 100) minus neutral cue score (out of 100):

checklist_7.Description: 7. Willing and capable of interacting with the informed consent process

checklist_8.Description: 1. Unwillingness or inability to complete any of the major aspects of the study protocol, including magnetic resonance imaging (i.e., due to claustrophobia), drug cue rating, or behavioral assessment.

checklist_9.Description: 2. Abstinence from Opioids for more than 6 months based on self-report
